meanings.definition: Create difficulties for (someone or something), resulting in delay or obstruction.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain will hinder our progress on the hike.
meanings.sent2: Traffic can hinder your commute to work in the morning.
meanings.sent3: Trying to tie my shoes with mittens on will surely hinder my efforts.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure seemed to always hinder her from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog hindered our ability to see the path clearly.

meanings.definition: A thing that provides resistance, delay, or obstruction to something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The locked gate acted as a hinder to our escape from the maze.
meanings.sent2: Lack of funding can be a hinder to the completion of the project.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator was a hinder to our plans of reaching the top floor.
meanings.sent4: The old tree roots served as a hinder to the construction of the new road.
meanings.sent5: The language barrier proved to be a significant hinder in their communication.
